title: Work permit
description: We assist with Canadian work permits, whether open, employer-specific, or LMIA-based, guiding workers and employers through a smooth, compliant process.

requirements.label: For employers
other: Prove there is a genuine need for a foreign worker.
Show no Canadian citizen or permanent resident is available for the job.
Provide a valid job offer with fair wages and safe working conditions.
Pay the LMIA processing fee (unless exempt).
Follow all Canadian labor laws.

requirements.label: For foreign worker
other: A valid job offer from a Canadian employer to work as a caregiver.
Meet the job’s qualifications, skills, or experience.
Show proof of funds to support themselves and their family.
Pass medical exams if required.
Provide police clearance if requested.
Convince immigration officers they will leave Canada when their permit expires (unless applying for permanent residency).

title: Caregiver program
description: We support caregivers applying through the Home Child Care Provider and Home Support Worker pilots, guiding them from eligibility and LMIA to work permits and permanent residence.

requirements.label: Job offer
requirements.description: A valid job offer from a Canadian employer to work as a caregiver.

requirements.label: Work experience
requirements.description: Relevant work experience in a caregiving role.

requirements.label: Language proficiency
requirements.description: Meet the minimum language requirements, typically Canadian Language Benchmark 5.

requirements.label: Education
requirements.description: A Canadian post-secondary education credential of at least one year, or an equivalent foreign credential with an Education Credential Assessment (ECA).

title: Family sponsorship
description: We help reunite families through Canada’s sponsorship programs, guiding parents, children, spouses, and relatives through every step with accurate, timely submissions.

title: Study & Visitor visa
description: We provide step-by-step support for students applying for study permits and visitors seeking short-term entry visas, ensuring requirements are met with ease.

requirements.label: For study permit
other: A valid letter of acceptance from a designated learning institution (DLI) in Canada.
Proof of financial support (tuition, living expenses, return travel).
Valid passport and supporting documents.
Meet health and security requirements.

requirements.label: For visitor visa
other: Valid passport.
Proof of financial support for the visit.
Clear reason for visiting (tourism, family visit, short course, or event).
Strong ties to home country to show intent to return.

title: PR & Citizenship
description: We provide end-to-end support for permanent residency and citizenship applications, from document preparation to interview readiness, ensuring a smooth path to your future in Canada.

requirements.label: Permanent residency (PR)
other: Must qualify through a recognized program (e.g., Express Entry, Caregiver Program, Family Sponsorship, Provincial Nominee Program)
Meet work, study, or residency requirements depending on the pathway
Provide proof of language proficiency (English or French)
Pass medical, security, and background checks

requirements.label: Citizenship
other: Must have been a permanent resident of Canada
Lived in Canada for at least 3 out of the last 5 years
Filed taxes, if required
Demonstrated language proficiency (for applicants aged 18–54)
Passed the Canadian citizenship test (where applicable)
